titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Gerard J. Schwarz papers 1986.040
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:20:04 +0000.

did.abstract: The Gerard J. Schwarz papers consist of school records and certificates of Gerard J. Schwarz and Eva Rohman (Schwarz's mother). Schwarz attended P.S. 137, William J. Morrison High School, Boys High, Brooklyn Evening Technical High School, and war training courses at Pratt Institute during World War II. Rohman attended Central Evening High School for Women. The papers span the period 1909 to 1949 and measure 0.08 linear feet.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Gerard J. Schwarz papers, 1986.040, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1986.
